intro: Gymnosporia lepidota var. ruwenzorica, commonly known as the Ruwenzori gymnosporia, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, compound leaves, and small, greenish-yellow flowers. It produces spherical, spiny fruits that contain edible seeds. This variety is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
